title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 30 May 2013 - XWiki
content:
<Denis> has quit  
02:40 <abusenius\_> has quit  
03:22 <altker1281> If anyone here is using nginx in-front of tomcat , please let me know.  I have a basic reverse-proxy config working , but looking for an example config for the gzip / static content.  
03:22 <altker1281> The example here is not using tomcat : http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/NginX  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
06:08 <cjd> has quit  
06:59 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:05 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <mflorea> Good morning everyone. Please don't commit on master, I'm releasing 5.1M1. Thanks.  
08:17 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:23 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:38 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <vmassol> sburjan`/msmeria  
09:55 <vmassol> hi  
09:55 <vmassol> something you could do today to help with BFD :)  
09:55 <msmeria> hello  
09:55 <vmassol> it's checking that http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6396 works on IE when you remove our CSS rule  
09:56 <vmassol> ie when "list-style-position: inside" is reoved  
09:56 <vmassol> \*removed  
09:56 <vmassol> if you could that on our supported IE versions then we could easily close this issue  
09:56 <evalica> vmassol: that rule will not be so easily removable - it will influence panels and lots of things  
09:57 <vmassol> evalica: can you comment on the issue?  
09:57 <evalica> it was done on purpose for Colibri and will need proper testing  
09:57 <vmassol> we still need to know  
09:57 <vmassol> it was done to fix an IE issue apparently  
09:57 <vmassol> but this issue may not exist anylore  
09:57 <evalica> I want to look for the duplicate, because there is another issue I commented on  
09:57 <vmassol> \*anymore  
09:57 <vmassol> "This is caused by CSS, there's a list-style-position: inside which was needed at some point to fix some bugs in Internet Explorer. We should investigate what breaks when disabling this rule."  
09:58 <vmassol> btw mflorea since the wysiwyg editor overrides this, does it mean the editor wouldn't work with IE?  
09:58 <evalica> I put that rule and I don't remember exactly all the reasons, but it was put on purpose  
09:58 <vmassol> that shows that comments are always needed in the code  
09:58 <vmassol> :)  
09:58 <vmassol> evalica: this value is overriden in the wysiwyg  
09:59 <mflorea> vmassol: you edit only the content, but lists are used outside the content of the page.  
09:59 <evalica> well … it fixed a lot of things … because we were using lists in many display elements  
09:59 <evalica> \*were/are  
09:59 <vmassol> we're starting to have several users complaining about the default style + we have an inconstientcy so we need to do something about it  
10:00 <vmassol> would be good to evaluate our options  
10:00 <mflorea> we all agree about this, some one need to apply the new style and see if there is any issues in IE  
10:01 <mflorea> as I said, I doubt there are any (they were probably in IE6/7), but we should still check  
10:01 <vmassol> which is why I was asking if manuel/sorin could check this  
10:11 <evalica> mflorea: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-4247?focusedCommentId=44327&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-44327 do you remember something about FF too?  
10:13 <mflorea> evalica: only in edit mode  
10:13 <evalica> k  
10:14 <mflorea> the reason I used position outside in edit mode was to fix a FF issue when editing lists  
10:14 <mflorea> the reason we used position inside view mode was (at least that's what I understood) to fix/overcome an issue in IE when viewing the page.  
10:15 <mflorea> so there are two different stories :)  
10:16 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
10:57 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <vmassol> mflorea: can I push on master?  
11:12 <mflorea> yes, except manager  
11:16 <mflorea> Maven release done.  
11:17 <vmassol> mflorea: is http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9183# a rergession?  
11:17 <vmassol> looks bad  
11:18 <mflorea> not sure yet, I haven't debugged the code but I'm planning to do  
11:18 <vmassol> should we mark it as blocker for 5.x and 5.1M2?  
11:18 <vmassol> ok  
11:18 <vmassol> I'll let you set it if it's important  
11:18 <mflorea> yes  
11:45 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <vmassol> has quit  
11:57 <Denis> mflorea: Hi, I am again on the DW, and I think I have found an odd behavior, I have been able to click on an update button while an update was already in progress, and it does not really do anything useful, so // update seems not possible.  
11:59 <mflorea> Hi Denis, in which screen?  
11:59 <mflorea> or step  
11:59 <Denis> the steps for upgrading all wikis  
12:00 <mflorea> what's the step name?  
12:00 <mflorea> "Extensions"?  
12:00 <Denis> dunno  
12:00 <mflorea> :)  
12:00 <Denis> I was on the proposal to upgrade the UI of all wikis  
12:00 <Denis> I was upgrading one of them  
12:01 <Denis> and I had click update on an extension that was also outdated  
12:01 <Denis> wiki manager extension in fact from the main wiki  
12:01 <mflorea> Denis: the DW has a header, is the "Extensions" the current step?  
12:01 <Denis> it is no more under my eyes :(  
12:01 <mflorea> ok  
12:01 <mflorea> I'll assume it is  
12:02 <mflorea> so  
12:02 <Denis> the step was after the question about upgrading all wiki or not  
12:02 <Denis> it propose 2 UI update, and 1 extension update  
12:03 <Denis> first UI was updated, second was updating, and I clicked on the extension update  
12:03 <mflorea> EM uses the job manager which doesn't run job in parallel. So when you click on the upgrade it \_schedules\_ the job (the job is put in a queue), but the job will be executed when the job manager is free  
12:03 <Denis> ok, so, this is essentially a feedback issue then ?  
12:04 <Denis> It have opened the details, but I was not aware something has been queued  
12:04 <mflorea> I don't know what you mean by "t does not really do anything useful"  
12:04 <Denis> I just saw the description tab  
12:04 <mflorea> you should see the progress bar at 0%  
12:04 <Denis> not at all, no plan has been established  
12:04 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:05 <Denis> I was at the first step, clicking update, not after the click on continue  
12:05 <mflorea> the extension details were hidden when you clicked upgrade?  
12:05 <Denis> yes, and it open on description tab  
12:06 <Denis> and nothing else happen  
12:06 <Denis> when the UI has finished, I clicked again on the update button  
12:06 <mflorea> ok, would have been good to know if the progress bar was displayed after a page refresh  
12:07 <Denis> I will try that next time and be more careful  
12:08 <mflorea> but normally, if no error occurs, the job is scheduler and the extension is redisplayed, and it's status should be loading, thus with progress bar. If the progress bar was missing I assume that either the job wasn't scheduler for some reason, or it was scheduled, but the extension was displayed before the job status was set to pending.  
12:09 <mflorea> s/scheduler/scheduled  
12:10 <mflorea> reloading the page would have proven if the second option was true (job state set to pending after the extension was displayed)  
12:10 <Denis> ok, be sure I will check next time, and I will let you know  
12:10 <mflorea> I assume there were no related exceptions in the log right?  
12:11 <mflorea> I mean, something saying that a job couldn't be scheduled or run  
12:12 <mflorea> most probably it's a synchronization issue between the extension display and the job status update  
12:15 <Denis> mflorea: I do not see anything in the log directly related, but btw, I have other job schedule issue (with PR right) that are in the log, but without a properly format, mainly no date, which make these log not really helpful  
12:16 <Denis> maybe totally unrelated, seems to be jobs of the scheduler  
12:17 <mflorea> the job manager and the job scheduler are different  
12:17 <Denis> yes I know  
12:17 <Denis> the message are not really clear  
12:17 <Denis> at least nothing about the DW  
12:17 <mflorea> anyway, I'll try to check when exactly the job status is set and if it's possible that the extension is displayed before.  
12:34 <vmassol> has quit  
12:36 <tdelafosse> has quit  
12:37 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:37 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
12:44 <sburjan> vmassol: hello. Could you create a component in XWiki Contrib JIRA called "Test Reporting Application" ?  
12:45 <vmassol> what versions do you need? has it been released already?  
12:45 <vmassol> I see 1.0 on e.x.o  
12:45 <vmassol> but I don't see 1.0 in jira  
12:45 <vmassol> so you need 1.0 and 1.1?  
12:46 <vmassol> done  
12:48 <sburjan> vmassol: I need 2.0, which is not yet released  
12:49 <sburjan> but very very soon  
12:56 <sburjan> I need this si I can put it in POM  
12:57 <vmassol> has quit  
13:02 <mflorea> has quit  
13:03 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:03 <vmassol> sburjan: why 2.0 and not 1.1?  
13:03 <vmassol> it looks really strange so soon  
13:03 <vmassol> 1.0 has been barely released already  
13:03 <sburjan> because it has been a big model change, breaking backward compatibility  
13:04 <sburjan> but if you say 1.1 is OK, I'll release as 1.1. But in the documentaion I wil lspecify about breaking backward compat  
13:04 <vmassol> as you wish  
13:05 <vmassol> let me know quickly, I'm on the version page so it's easy for me to add a new version now  
13:05 <vmassol> :)  
13:05 <sburjan> go fo 2.0 :)  
13:05 <sburjan> Today or Tomorrow I will send the [Vote]  on devlist to decide where will we install it so we can go in production  
13:05 <vmassol> done  
13:05 <vmassol> no VOTE  
13:06 <vmassol> proposal is enough IMO  
13:06 <vmassol> following sdumitriu's goal of reducing votes  
13:06 <vmassol> ;)  
13:07 <sburjan> Ok. Proposal it is :)  
13:26 <sburjan> vmassol: thanks  
13:36 <\_Frank> has quit  
13:44 <kstuart> has quit  
13:47 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
13:56 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <altker1281> has quit  
14:08 <sburjan> Hello. can someone tell me if is it possible to add an object to a page programatically but only after the object has been created and populated ?  
14:14 <vmassol> sburjan: createNewObject should do that no?  
14:14 <vmassol> it's the same as newObject btw  
14:15 <sburjan> yes. but I don't have yet computed the page I want to attach the object  
14:16 <vmassol> then you can use:     public void addXObject(BaseObject object)  
14:16 <vmassol> after you've created the BaseObject  
14:17 <vmassol> I don't know if we have any scripting api for creating a BaseObject though  
14:17 <vmassol> in groovy it's possible but apart from that I don't know  
14:18 <vmassol> said differently you should add the object after you have the doc object  
14:32 <Denis> has quit  
14:32 <msmeria> I tried to install the FAQ App on a XE 4.5.4 and was aunable to do it. I got the following message: "Dependency [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-wikimacro-store-5.0.2] is not compatible with core extension [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-wikimacro-store-4.5.4]"  
14:34 <msmeria> this only happens when trying to install the latest 5.0.2 version. If I use advanced search I'm able to install the 4.5.4 version  
14:34 <sdumitriu> That's normal  
14:34 <sdumitriu> What's not normal is that it proposes 5.0.2, it should propose a compatible version  
14:35 <msmeria> exactly  
14:35 <vmassol> I don't understand why advanced search would allow you to install it  
14:36 <vmassol> would need thomas to understand this  
14:36 <vmassol> maybe some check is not done there but that doesn't seem correct  
14:37 <vmassol> regarding last compatible version maybe it's http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-199  
14:37 <sburjan> vmassol: because the regular user does not know Maven, nor what groupID or artefactID is  
14:38 <vmassol> sburjan: what question are you answering?  
14:38 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Advanced search -> search for the 4.5.4 version explicitly  
14:38 <vmassol> that's not the question  
14:38 <vmassol> the question is why does the EM allow you to install something incompartible  
14:39 <sdumitriu> That's how advanced search works, it requires both the id and the version  
14:39 <vmassol> that's a bug IMO  
14:39 <vmassol> again that's not the problem  
14:39 <vmassol> msmeria said he was able to install a 5.0.2 version on 4.5.4  
14:39 <vmassol> that's not normal  
14:39 <sdumitriu> Vincent, msmeria didn't install 5.0.2 through advanced search, he installed 4.5.4  
14:39 <msmeria> vmassol: I didn't say that  
14:39 <sdumitriu> Right msmeria?  
14:39 <vmassol> ahhh  
14:40 <vmassol> so he tried to install different things  
14:40 <vmassol> comparing apples and oranges :)  
14:40 <vmassol> thought he said he succeed when using advanced search  
14:40 <vmassol> I feel better  
14:40 <vmassol> :)  
14:40 <sdumitriu> Read above: "If I use advanced search I'm able to install the 4.5.4 version"  
14:40 <msmeria> on a clean xe 4.5.4 by default EM proposes faq 5.0.2 to install  
14:40 <msmeria> which I couldn't install..  
14:40 <vmassol> yes this is known AFAIK  
14:40 <vmassol> right now the EM doesn't propose compatible versions  
14:40 <vmassol> AFAIR it's complex to implement  
14:41 <vmassol> would need to ask thomas again  
14:41 <msmeria> then that's the bug  
14:41 <vmassol> it's not a bug  
14:41 <vmassol> there's no bug  
14:41 <vmassol> it's working as planned  
14:41 <vmassol> the only thing missing ATM is a feature  
14:41 <vmassol> the feature to display only compatible versions  
14:41 <vmassol> the EM correctly preevents you from installing not compatible versions  
14:41 <vmassol> so there's no bug  
14:42 <vmassol> btw you can now see listed other versions  
14:42 <vmassol> so you can click on them  
14:42 <vmassol> you don't need to use advanced search  
14:42 <vmassol> also  
14:43 <msmeria> I see  
14:43 <vmassol> you should know that ATM we're making things simple  
14:43 <sburjan> vmassol, DW is also hit by this. Step 3 in DW will ALWAYS propose the LATEST versions. so I am migrating to 5.0.2, but step 3 proposes extensions in 5.1-SNAP  
14:43 <vmassol> by specifying in the pom only versions greater than the corresponding XWiki versions  
14:43 <vmassol> said differently  
14:44 <vmassol> we could very well say on the pom of Faq 5.0.2  
14:44 <vmassol> that it's compatible with 4.5.4  
14:44 <vmassol> we just don't do this because it's too much work to test  
14:45 <vmassol> (with 4.5.4 = with its dependencies in version 4.5.4)  
14:45 <vmassol> imagine the work you'd get :)

18:51 <sdumitriu1> vmassol: About the unparsed mails from Jenkins, I don't think the problem is that a doesn't use the default template, since I see it correctly uses "BUILD\_LOG\_REGEX"  
18:54 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
18:56 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
19:09 <vmassol> sdumitriu1: that's the global config  
19:09 <vmassol> but maybe we have some jobs that override the default config  
19:10 <sdumitriu1> Why override, since that's what I see in the mail  
19:10 <vmassol> I don't know, just trying to find a reason  
19:10 <vmassol> because it works for most jobs  
19:10 <vmassol> the problem is that since the variable are not resolved we don't know the jobs that don't work
